unnormalised: ## Riding the Viral Wave: What's Hot in Social Media & Influencer Marketing (Right Now!)
normalised: ## Riding the Viral Wave: What's Hot in Social Media and Influencer Marketing (Right Now!)

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered how a meme like "Rasode mein kaun tha?" blew up overnight? Or how that random dance video from a wedding in Jaipur became a global sensation? That's the magic (and sometimes mayhem) of virality in social media!
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever wondered how a meme like "Rasode mein kaun tha?" blew up overnight? Or how that random dance video from a wedding in Jaipur became a global sensation? That's the magic (and sometimes mayhem) of virality in social media!

unnormalised: In the ever-shifting landscape of social media & influencer marketing, staying on top of viral trends is crucial. What worked yesterday might be ancient history tomorrow. Think about it: remember when everyone was doing the Ice Bucket Challenge back in 2014? Now, it feels like ages ago.

unnormalised: So, what's trending right now, especially in the Indian context? Well, authenticity is key. People are tired of overly polished, picture-perfect content. They want real, relatable stories. Influencers like Bhuvan Bam, who built his empire on everyday humor and relatable characters, are a testament to this.

unnormalised: Another major trend? Short-form video. Thanks to platforms like Instagram Reels and YouTube Shorts, easily digestible content reigns supreme. Think quick recipe tutorials using masalas your Dadi used to make, short comedy sketches about the struggles of online classes, or dance challenges set to Bollywood hits. Anything under 60 seconds has a higher chance of catching fire. Remember that catchy song that went viral on 26/01/2023? Proof positive!

unnormalised: And let's not forget the power of user-generated content (UGC). Encouraging your audience to create content around your product or brand can be a game-changer. Run a contest, launch a hashtag campaign, and watch the magic happen! Just make sure to monitor the content and avoid any controversies (remember that Tanishq ad fiasco in 2020?).

unnormalised: But virality isn't just about luck. It's about understanding your audience, tapping into current cultural conversations (maybe even the latest episode of Koffee with Karan!), and creating content that resonates. It's about being nimble and ready to adapt to the latest trends. Plus, knowing when the next big festival, like Diwali on 12/11, is coming up so you can piggyback on that!
